_prev_prog_3.Description: Golden Sierra Cold Storage is committed to preventing accidental releases that could threaten the environment or harm people.  To mitigate the potential for accidents commonly associated with anhydrous ammonia refrigeration systems, we have instituted a Process Safety Management plan that is compliant with both the Environmental Protection Agency and the California Department of Occupational Safety and Health.  We have re-focused our safety efforts to be more diligent than ever to prevent releases.  We are instituting all aspects of PSM at our facility to ensure ongoing safe operation of our refrigeration system.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

GOLDEN SIERRA COLD STORAGE

12582 Avenue 384, Cutler CA 93615





Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Golden Sierra Cold Storage is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment at our facility. 



It is our policy to ensure that controls are in place to prevent possible releases of ammonia. If such a release does occur, our emergency response personnel are trained to control and mitigate the effects of the release. 



The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage' primary activities at our facility located at 12582 Avenue 384, Cutler CA 93615 are the grading, packing, and shipping of citrus products. Anhydrous ammonia is our only regulated substance, and is used to provide refrigeration for our products. 



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 

Our facility is in full compliance with the EPA's accidental release prevention requirements as defined in 40 CFR Part 68, the requirements for the California Accidental Release Prevention program (CalARP), the OSHA PSM requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119, and the EPCRA Section 302 notification requirements. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that are in place at our facility, located at 12582 Avenue 384, Cutler CA 93615.



Process Safety Information 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment specifications associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment and process.  Most of this documentation is in the form of Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) manuals, housed in the

office of the Cold Storage Manager at 12582 Avenue 384, Cutler CA 93615



Process Hazards Analysis 

Our facility has conducted a comprehensive study to ensure that hazards associated with our ammonia system is identified and effectively controlled. Te chosen method for this Process Hazard Analysis was ?What-If?. This study was undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations, and will be revalidated at least every five years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner. 



Operating Procedures 

To further ensure that activities are safely conducted in our ammonia system, Golden Sierra Cold Storage has developed written operating procedures to supplement our current on-the-job operator training. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operation, normal shutdown and startup, and emergency shutdown and startup. This information is regularly reviewed and readily accessible to operators involved in the processes. 

 



Training 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage has an on-the-job training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating process equipment are competent in the operating procedures associated with this equipment. Written procedures are used to enhance the on-the-job training. Refresher training is provided at least every three years. Documentation of all training is held in our main office at 12582 Avenue 384, Cutler CA 93615



 

Mechanical Integrity 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage has a written maintenance program in place for preventative maintenance of all ammonia equipment to ensure continuing reliable and safe operation. Equipment maintained under this program includes: Pressure vessels; Piping systems; Relief and vent systems; Emergency shutdown systems; Controls; Compressors; and Pumps. This maintenance is completed only by qualified personnel with training in maintenance practices. Specialized training is provided as

needed to ensure maintenance personnel are fully qualified. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner. 



Management of Change 

Written procedures are followed at Golden Sierra Cold Storage to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures. This ensures that process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification. 



Pre-startup Reviews 

Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes will be conducted as a regular practice at Golden Sierra Cold Storage It is our goal to ensure that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing new or re-conditioned equipment into operation. 



Compliance Audits 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage will conduct audits on a regular basis to verify that the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. These audits will be carried out at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits will be undertaken in a safe and prompt manner. 



Incident Investigation 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage will promptly investigate any incident that has resulted in, or could have resulted in the release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from occurring under similar situations. All reports will be retained for a minimum of 5 years. 



Employee Participation 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort and has developed a written plan to implement this philosophy. Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention is

sues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule, particularly information resulting from process hazard analyses. 



Contractor Safety 

On occasion, our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Golden Sierra Cold Storage has a strict policy of informing the contractors of any known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes within our facility. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur. 



Five-year Accident History 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage has had a good record of preventing accidental releases. No incidents have occurred over the last 5 years. 



Emergency Response Plan 

Golden Sierra Cold Storage has developed a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. 



To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response. 



Golden Sierra Cold Storage coordinates its emergency response plan with the Region 5 LEPC and the Tulare County Fire Department. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

The following changes are planned or are already underway to improve the level of safety within our plant. These include: 

-    Re-validation of our written Standard Operating Procedures

-    Re-validation of our written Maintenance Procedures

-    Additional training for facility employees

-    Label all piping and valves
